content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Given a DataFrame df_cars with column `model`, write a function `count_model_rows` that groups data by model and calculate how many rows there are for each.

In Julia, you can use the `groupby` function from the DataFramesMeta package to group your DataFrame by a specific column (in this case `model`) and then use the `count` function to count the number of rows in each group. Here is how you can do it:

```julia
using DataFrames, DataFramesMeta

function count_model_rows(df_cars::DataFrame)
    return nrow.(groupby(df_cars, :model))
end
```

This function `count_model_rows` returns an array of the number of rows in each group (i.e., for each unique model). 

Please note that this function assumes you have already added DataFramesMeta to your project with the Pkg.add("DataFramesMeta") command. If it's not installed, Julia's package manager will automatically add it when you first use it in your code.
